Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Master sustainable business practices to boost operational performance, focusing on SEA and B Corp certifications for long-term growth and resilience.

In today’s fast-changing business landscape, sustainability is key to success. Businesses are embracing sustainable practices to meet environmental standards, adhere to regulations, and boost operational performance, ensuring long-term growth and resilience.

Incorporating sustainable practices benefits the environment while driving business growth and opens up valuable career opportunities. This course is designed to help SME owners and business leaders integrate sustainability into their operations, with a focus on Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) by The International Society of Sustainability Professionals (ISSP) and B Corp certification by B Lab. It provides clear guidance on understanding and implementing sustainable practices both individually and within their companies. The course offers practical insights, interactive discussions and case studies, making it ideal for learners starting their certification journey, aiming to align with Singapore’s sustainability goals, or seeking foundational knowledge in sustainability for business growth.

This course is essential for learners seeking to deepen their sustainability knowledge and enhance their skills. It provides a comprehensive understanding of key sustainability concepts and practices. Upon completion, learners can emerge as sustainability leaders, driving meaningful change within their organisations. This expertise ensures compliance with Singapore’s regulatory standards and enhances overall business performance, making it a valuable asset for any career in today’s sustainability-driven marketplace.
This course is a collaboration with
SME owners looking to incorporate sustainability into their business operations
Professionals, managers, executives, businessmen or middle managers responsible for implementing and managing sustainability initiatives within their organisations
Companies seeking to achieve SEA by ISSP or B Corp certification while aligning with Singapore’s Sustainability initiatives and regulatory compliance
Entrepreneurs and startup owners interested in building a foundational understanding of sustainability in a business context and pursuing SEA by ISSP certification
Introduction to SEA by ISSP certification
Benefits of the SEA by ISSP certification, the certification process and key knowledge areas
Foundational sustainability concepts, including the triple bottom line and energy-efficient technologies
Valuation of different types of capital and introduces green technology tools
Critical social and environmental issues, including equity, human rights, climate change, and pollution
Practical real-world case studies from companies like Lenovo that illustrate the effective use of sustainability technologies
UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and their relevance to modern business practices
Systems thinking and the interconnections between social, environmental, and economic systems
Practical and interactive exercises that apply system thinking and the application of green building technologies to real-world business challenges
Benefits and risks of sustainability for businesses
Global policies and initiatives, focusing on regulatory trends and their impacts on businesses
Case studies of Singapore's sustainability start-ups, highlighting insights and lessons of their journeys from inception
B Corp certification process, its benefits, and key impact areas
Ethical governance practices, emphasising transparency and accountability
Worker rights and well-being, covering fair compensation, benefits, and employee engagement in sustainability initiatives
Community impact strategies, including diversity, inclusion, and sustainable supply chain management
Overview of the B Impact Assessment tool, including strategies for maximising scores and continuous improvement
Best practices for worker rights and well-being through relevant case studies
Leverage B Lab's frameworks to address legal requirements and corporate governance and adaptations
Effective stakeholder management and transparent communication strategies
Align sustainability objectives with stakeholder interests to foster positive relationships
Associate Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Jeffrey Koh is a transdisciplinary creative practitioner with a background in Fine Art, Experience Design, and Engineering Sciences. He has a Ph.D. from the National University of Singapore, and is a certified ACLP and CIRCO trainer.

With his diverse background and expertise, Jeffrey has worked on a range of projects including catwalk and fashion show designs for PRADA, advertising and gallery curation for KesselsKramer, and architecture and exhibition design for the Office for Metropolitan Architecture / Rem Koolhaas.

As a practising artist, Jeffrey has showcased his work in prestigious venues such as the Barbican and Southbank Centre in London, the Singapore Design Festival, and in galleries located in Munster, Berlin, Vienna, Crete, Tokyo, among other world-class venues.

Jeffrey has studied Semiotics and Fashion Photography and obtained his BFA in Monumental Kunst from the Aki Academy of Art and Design (ArtEZ) in Enschede, the Netherlands, as well as an MA in Creative Practice for Narrative Environments from Central Saint Martins College of Art & Design in London, United Kingdom. He also earned a d.MBA in business design in 2021.

Moreover, Jeffrey's research interests have focused on various topics related to HCI, HRI, interactivity, and transdisciplinary experimental creative practice. He obtained his PhD from the National University of Singapore and was a visiting research scholar at Keio University in Japan.

Previously, Jeffrey served as the UX Lead at the National Gallery Singapore, a Peer of the Australia Council for the Arts, a faculty Lecturer at UNSW, Vice President of Transmedia at Villains, and a Partner at Chemistry. He currently serves as an Advisory Board Member at Chemistry, as well as Ngee Ann Polytechnic's School of Design, is a founding member of the World Economic Forum Singapore Chapter, and is an Associate Professor at SIT, focusing on regenerative design and the circular economy.
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Jisu Kim, an Assistant Professor at the Singapore Institute of Technology, holds a Ph.D. in Mass Communication from the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities. Her research focuses on enhancing public engagement and trust through digital technologies, with a particular emphasis on social media and artificial intelligence. She has developed strategies and tools for better communication and audience interaction, collaborating with various organisations to achieve these goals. As an Affiliate Fellow at Yale Law School's Information Society Project, Dr. Kim's interdisciplinary approach integrates digital innovation with sustainability, making her expertise highly relevant to green transformation initiatives.
Assistant Professor , Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor , Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Mark Teo is an Assistant Professor of Design in the Business, Communication and Design cluster at the Singapore Institute of Technology. He has more than 15 years of experience, straddling practice and higher education, and has practiced in Singapore, Australia, and Canada. Mark is interested in how spaces impact people’s lifestylesand vice versa. He has crafted and overseen projects ranging from small lighting installations to conservation shophouses and multi-unit high-rise residential developments. Mark is a member of the Singapore Institute of Architects and served on the Sustainability Committee in 2009, during which he was a contributor to the institute’s policy paper on the attributes of a sustainable built environment. He is also serving on both the Sustainability Education Committee and the Sustainability Work Group at  the Singapore Institute of Technology. His current research interests are in human-centred design, sustainability, urban agriculture, and food security.
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Thomas Goh is a faculty member at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), specialising in the Digital Communications and Interactive Media program. He is currently pursuing a Doctorate in Business Administration at the Singapore University of Social Sciences, with a focus on Sustainable Digital Transformation, expected to be completed in 2025. With over two decades of professional experience in digital marketing and business transformation at companies like Microsoft, Citibank, and Ogilvy, Tom's teaching integrates practical industry insights with academic theories. His research centres on how small businesses can use digital technologies, particularly AI, to achieve sustainability goals. He actively contributes to the community, serving on the Executive Committees of the Interaction Design Foundation, Singapore Heart Foundation, and Singapore Cancer Society.

Bee Hian is an associate trainer at Capelle Consulting. With more than 20 years of Asia Pacific experience in market research and insights, she has worked with clients from diverse industries such as Banking, Electronics, FMCG, IT, Media and Pharmaceuticals to address different business needs and challenges. Being a keen follower of the developments in the sustainability sphere, Bee Hian is combining her interest in ESG issues with her business consulting skills to help more businesses get on board the sustainability bandwagon. From stakeholder communications to product redesigns, she has helped clients identify directions to start making a difference on the road towards sustainability.

Mia is a highly experienced learning consultant and courseware developer at Capelle Consulting, with over 20 years of expertise in capability development. She has collaborated with diverse industries to create and deliver impactful learning solutions that align with organisational goals. A passionate advocate for sustainability, Mia has completed the BCG RISE: Green Economy for Senior Leaders program and is a member of the International Society of Sustainability Professionals. Her recent work focuses on developing ESG-focused courseware, particularly in social and environmental areas, making sustainability concepts accessible. Mia is dedicated to empowering workers to understand and navigate the impacts of ESG on their roles, equipping them to embrace the challenges and opportunities of a sustainable future.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$4,360.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
Interested in this course for your business or team?
Tailored to your organisation's specific training needs, we can help you design and develop custom courses to grow key talent and build specialist expertise to meet the future demands of work.
Why is the course 4 days long?

The 4-day duration allows for in-depth coverage of sustainability principles, SEA by ISSP and B Corp certification, along with practical case studies and interactive discussions, ensuring comprehensive learning and skill development.
What distinguishes this course from others?

This course prepares learners for globally renowned industry credentials (SEA by ISSP), providing step-by-step guidance for green transformation through the use of B Lab's B Impact Assessment and the B Corp certification process, includes in-depth case studies from industry leaders like Lenovo, HP, Intel, AMD, and Dell, ensuring its relevance and impact in the market.
Is there external accreditation for the course

The course does prepare a learner for external accreditation through certifications like SEA by ISSP and prepares the companies for B Corp certification, which are recognised globally for their rigorous standards and industry relevance, enhancing the learner’s professional credentials and marketability. (Note - Learners need to register for their exams independently).
How will this course enhance my organisation’s sustainability and competitiveness?
This course equips learners with practical tools and strategies to integrate sustainability into their organisations, enhancing competitiveness, reputation, and long-term viability.
What prior knowledge or experience is required?
The course is designed for SME owners, managers, and entrepreneurs interested in sustainability, with no specific prior knowledge or experience required.
Will I receive support to apply the sustainability practices learned in this programmme within my organisation?
Yes, this programme offers practical guidance and real-world case studies to help learners effectively implement sustainability practices within their organisations.
Are there networking opportunities with other participants and industry experts?

Yes, the course features interactive sessions, discussions, and networking opportunities, allowing participants to share ideas, learn from industry experts, and build valuable connections within the sustainability community.
How will completing this course impact my career or professional development?

Completing this course enhances learners' sustainability knowledge, credentials, and skills, opening doors to new career opportunities, promotions, and leadership roles within their organisations and the broader industry.
SIT Punggol Campus, 1 Punggol Coast Road, Singapore 828608
